channel.title: [BASIC] [PI] Command Knowledge [PI] [BASIC]
channel.description:
Well im sick and tired of seeing people begging for command help in the server help section. I know this wont get rid of them, but hopefully reduce the amount by alittle bit.
I was gonna make this a big tutorial on PI commands, but i decided that im gonna make a basic and advanced tutorial, so people can be more accurate with what there looking for.
Difficulty - 2/10
[u][b]1. Basic Command Platforms[/b][/u]
There are many command platforms that make the command come together, im going too show you all of them, them how to customize them too your liking, to build your command
Command Base [code] if (playerCommand.startsWith("YOURCOMMANDHERE")) {[/code]
This is how all commands will start, It is declaring what you will type after ::
There are also different things you can do to make it so certain people can do these commands. Like this..
[code] if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("YOURCOMMANDHERE") && c.playerRights -- PRIGHTSHERE) {[/code]
Also there are things you can edit so that you can make it so that right, and anything above/under it, anyone but people with that right, or just people with that right can do it. You must replace the -- with the things below to activate what they explain
== - Only that right can use this command >= - Anyone with that right and above can use this command <= Anyone with that right and under can use this command
Player rights.. 0 - Player 1 - Moderator 2 - Administrator 3 - Super Administrator/Owner 4 - Hidden admin (usually)
And if you want anybody too use the command, completely remove the && c.playerRights statement.
More platforms are..
[code] c.getItems().addItem(ITEMIDHERE, ITEMAMOUTHERE);[/code]
[code] c.sendMessage("YOURMESSAGEHERE");[/code]
Also after the end of the command be sure to add a } so it declares the command is over.
Finished Command
[code] if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("YOURCOMMANDHERE") && c.playerRights -- PRIGHTSHERE) { c.getItems().addItem(ITEMIDHERE, ITEMAMOUNTHERE); c.sendMessage("YOURMESSAGEHERE"); }[/code]

item.title: [BASIC] [PI] Command Knowledge [PI] [BASIC]
item.dc:creator: @no1toldme2 no1toldme2
item.description:
@no1toldme2 wrote:

[quote=“orcashark, post:6, topic:401939”][quote author=no1toldme2 link=topic=498993.msg3652653#msg3652653 date=1309829586]
Can’t you just use a command gen :D, But nice job. 6/10 Needs some work…
[/quote]

Erm. What work does it need?

Plus command generators are messy :s[/quote]
If you make again make commands advanced like how to add gfxs to them ( not that hard ) but I mean like adding stats like master and say which one is which stat like 1 hp or w.e

Read full topic

item.title: [BASIC] [PI] Command Knowledge [PI] [BASIC]
item.dc:creator: @orcashark orcashark
item.description:
@orcashark wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Another thing;

[quote author=orcashark link=topic=498993.msg3649037#msg3649037 date=1309590668]
Command Base

This is how all commands will start, It is declaring what you will type after ::
[/quote]Not sure if it’s technically better, but it would be smarter to only use String.startsWith(String) when the command follows with arguments.[/quote]

Yeah but like i said this is basic, easy commands. Advanced is in progress

Read full topic

item.title: [BASIC] [PI] Command Knowledge [PI] [BASIC]
item.dc:creator: @halflive9 halflive9
item.description:
@halflive9 wrote:

Well, good tutorial so far. It will help a lot of beginning coders and maybe it will reduce the command questions in the server help section. Although some still will ask it there. Keep the good work up

Read full topic

item.title: [BASIC] [PI] Command Knowledge [PI] [BASIC]
item.dc:creator: @vManlyMan vManlyMan
item.description:
@vManlyMan wrote:

Quote from: orcashark on Today at 02:11:08 AM Code: [Select] if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("YOURCOMMANDHERE") && c.playerRights -- PRIGHTSHERE) { c.getItems().addItem(ITEMIDHERE, ITEMAMOUNTHERE); c.sendMessage("YOURMESSAGEHERE"); } wut is the ' -- ' denoting ?

This?

Also there are things you can edit so that you can make it so that right, and anything above/under it, anyone but people with that right, or just people with that right can do it. You must replace the -- with the things below to activate what they explain

== - Only that right can use this command

= - Anyone with that right and above can use this command
<= Anyone with that right and under can use this command
